title: If Joe Biden wins the presidency and the Democrats take the Senate, should Democrats pass hate speech laws? - Quora

response.answer_text: There should be no hate speech laws. Here's the thing about protecting free speech; it isn't necessary for popular speech. Then there's the whole ‘who defines hate speech' shtick, like when the news railed against Amy Coneh Barrett because she said sexual PREFERENCE instead of the preferred nomeclature du jour. Or like all the people out there saying a MAGA hat is a Nazi symbol. No, the best way is to leave speech free. And if I hear ‘hur dur fire in a crowded theatre,’ I swear. That idiotic talking point has been bandied around for too long, ignoring the actual case was SUPPRESSING POLITICAL SPEECH BY ANARCHISTS WHO ENCOURAGED PEOPLE TO BURN THEIR DRAFT CARDS and was one of the worst speech decisions in the country's history.

No. Even a liberal Supreme Court would look askance at all but the most narrow and carefully tailored impositions on the First Amendment. The current conservative Supreme Court can absolutely be counted on to strike down any hate speech legislation even if it is narrow and carefully tailored. Original question: If Joe Biden wins the presidency and the Democrats take the Senate, should Democrats pass hate speech laws?
